intro: Pilosella glaucescens subsp. ferroviae, commonly known as the iron road pilosella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, blue to purple composite flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
